definitions.definition: A hole or break caused by tearing.
definitions.example: A small tear is easy to mend, if it is on the seam.

definitions.definition: To rend (a solid material) by holding or restraining in two places and pulling apart, whether intentionally or not; to destroy or separate.
definitions.example: He tore his coat on the nail.

definitions.definition: To injure as if by pulling apart.
To destroy or reduce abstract unity or coherence, such as social, political or emotional.
definitions.example: He was torn by conflicting emotions.

definitions.definition: To make (an opening) with force or energy.
definitions.example: A piece of debris tore a tiny straight channel through the satellite.

definitions.definition: (often with off or out) To remove by tearing.
definitions.example: Tear the coupon out of the newspaper.
The slums were torn down to make way for the new development.

definitions.definition: To move or act with great speed, energy, or violence.
definitions.example: He tore into the backlog of complaints.

definitions.definition: To smash or enter something with great force.
definitions.example: The chain shot tore into the approaching line of infantry.

definitions.definition: A drop of clear, salty liquid produced from the eyes by crying or irritation.
definitions.example: Ryan wiped the tear from the paper he was crying on.

definitions.definition: Something in the form of a transparent drop of fluid matter; also, a solid, transparent, tear-shaped drop, as of some balsams or resins.
(glass manufacture) A partially vitrified bit of clay in glass.
That which causes or accompanies tears; a lament; a dirge.

definitions.example: Her eyes began to tear in the harsh wind.
